meanings.def: the person in charge of a ship or commercial aircraft
examples: The captain gave the order to abandon ship.
The captain of the ship invited them to dine at his table.
The captain of the plane was already announcing our arrival.
Her husband had been a ship's captain.

meanings.def: an officer of fairly high rank in the navy, the army and the US air force
examples: She has since been promoted to the rank of captain.
Her father had been a captain in the army.

meanings.def: the leader of a group of people, especially a sports team
examples: She's a former captain of the English national team.
He has just been made team captain.
The appointment of the former England captain as their new manager is bound to boost morale.

meanings.def: an officer of high rank in a US police or fire department
to be a captain of a sports team or a ship
examples: Ellis is expected to captain the side in next week's friendly against Argentina.
He played in the West Indies team captained by Clive Lloyd.
He told us about the ship he had captained during the war.
She will captain England on their tour to Australia.
